titleStmt.title: An Electronic Version of the first page of Chaucer's Knight's Tale

publicationStmt.p: Published on GitHub as part of DHUM1100/5100

sourceDesc.p: This example has been created by transcribing and marking up the first page of Chaucer's Knight's Tale, MS EL 26 C9 of the Canterbury Tales (late 14th century) at the Huntington Library, working from the image found at https://www.bl.uk/collection-items/ellesmere-manuscript

body.l: Whilom as olde stories tellen us
Ther was a duc yt highte Theseus
Of Atthenes he was lord and gov(er)nour
and in his tyme sich a conquerour
That gretter was ther noon under the sonne
Ful many a riche contree hadde he wonne
